title: T-Rex goes extinct
text: The Tyrannosaurus rex, one of the most iconic dinosaurs, went extinct approximately 66 million years ago during the Cretaceous-Paleogene extinction event.

title: First Dinosaurs Appear
text: Dinosaurs first appeared during the Triassic period, around 230 million years ago, marking the beginning of their dominance on Earth for over 160 million years.

title: Jurassic Period Begins
text: The Jurassic period, known for the abundance and diversity of dinosaurs, began around 201 million years ago and lasted until about 145 million years ago.

title: Cretaceous Period Begins
text: The Cretaceous period, the last and longest segment of the Mesozoic Era, began around 145 million years ago and ended with the mass extinction event that wiped out the dinosaurs.

title: Pangaea Supercontinent Breaks Apart
text: The supercontinent Pangaea began to break apart around 175 million years ago during the Jurassic period, leading to the formation of the continents as we know them today.

title: Cretaceous-Paleogene Extinction Event (Meteor Impact)
text: A massive asteroid impact around 66 million years ago is widely believed to have caused the mass extinction event that led to the demise of the dinosaurs and many other species.
